c74object.name: abc.scope
c74object.digest: Abclib's Visualization of X-Y signals using Jitter
c74object.description:
abc.scope is an abstraction to be used within a bpatcher in association with abc.hoa.scope~ object to visualize X-Y signals for instance ambisonic components at the order N. There are 3 signal inputs: X signal, Y signal and a binary signal (1/0) to tell the drawing corresponds to positive (red) values or negative (blue) ones.
Three parameters can be set:
- the type of drawing: points or lines
- the size of the drawing (1 by default)
- display on/off the floating window with the visualization.
The three default values can be set thanks to the bpatcher inspector. A unique 4 digit number is attributed to each instance and each visualization window.

objarg.name: drawing-type
objarg.description: [ONLY IN INSPECTOR] type of drawing (points or lines).

objarg.name: drawing-size
objarg.description: [ONLY IN INSPECTOR] size of the drawing.

objarg.name: window-display
objarg.digest: display on/off the floating window of the visualization
objarg.description: [ONLY IN INSPECTOR] display on/off the floating window of the visualization
